page.title: 16Transport in South Clifton
page.content: South Clifton is an isolated village in many repects.It is about 12 miles from Lincoln and Newark and about 14 miles from Gainsborough.It has no public bus service apart from a bus run by a private bus company,on a wednesday at 9.45 which takes shoppers to Newark market.It returns about 1.30 in the afternoon. Until the Beeching axe in 1963 there was a train service from North Clifton Station which meant a walk of about 1 mile.The railway line has been closed since a derailment in 1973.It is now a necessity to possess a car if you do not wish to be cut off from the outside world.Many people have to rely on the goodwill of friends and neighbours to take them into town.
